intro: Oxypetalum pannosum, commonly known as the silky oxypetalum, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in the summer months. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a velvety texture, contributing to its common name. Oxypetalum pannosum is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
